contents.contents: Stand with your back to the church and follow the ”Rue Notre Dame”. You should be able to see the Tower of Notre Dame du Val.

This tower was built in the 16th century and is the only part left from the collegiate church of Notre Dame du Val which was destroyed during the French Revolution. It has recently been renovated but cannot be visited.

question.contents: What was the tower built for?
choices: As an entrance to the chapter house of Notre-Dame-du-Val
As a church tower for the Saint Ayoul church

explanations.contents: Until the French Revolution, it was the entrance to the chapter house of Notre-Dame-du-Val and the tower for the Saint Ayoul church.
